comments.author: Narax.7605
comments.body:
Drakma.1549:

While they have provided a good service for the last few months, I don’t believe people should stop making their own apps/web sites just because mos started using the API.

and thank you!

I agree, I already started creating a live wvw status page even if there is MoS. I just wanted to wait for the API coming out, it’s not that MoS invented server status pages.

Drakma.1549:
Ofek.1743:

http://mos.millenium.org/na/

And?

Sorry I was busy when I posted, so that alone did indeed seem rude lol. I just wanted to inform you that that site started using the API today. When I found out I stopped writing mine.

Good work!

comments.author: Drakma.1549
comments.body:
Some forums don’t allow dynamic links for images. Here is the fix for it.

http://gw2stats.net/gc/[WORLD ID].png where [WORLD ID] is one of the world ID’s above

I should not that this grabs the latest published data. By published data, I mean data that I pull from the API and store. It does not pull directly from the API, but instead grabs from the API, massages it, stores it, verifies it and the publishes it.

I am currently updating about once every 15 seconds.

comments.author: Ayusaki.6739
comments.body:
Please consider starting a GitHub or a GoogleCode page so that the community can contribute pull requests in order to help further the development of this project you are working on.

I am a full supporter of open source, and with a community this interested to dive in and utilize this new feature (API) I’m sure they would be too.
